title.narrative: MoMo 4 Climate -Ghana

description.narrative: Mobilising More 4 Climate (MoMo4C) is a five-year program that aims to bring together entrepreneurs, firms, policymakers, investors and civil society organisations to make green business propositions that tackle the impacts and causes of climate change at a landscape level in developing countries, and to attract investments to implement these initiatives.

title.narrative: 2020 Work Plan Ghana
Inception report MoMo4C Ghana

title.narrative: # outcomes achieved within outcome pillar Lessons learned
Actors invest in climate-resilient landscapes

description.narrative: Interventions can use various financial instruments. OECD-DAC has developed methods to estimate the finance mobilisation for guarantees, syndicated loans, shares in collective investment vehicles, direct investment in companies, credit lines, standard grants & loans in co-financing arrangements and project finance. Thus, we can assess the total amount of finance mobilized for climate resiliance.

title.narrative: # USD climate and biodiversity finance mobilized

description.narrative: USD leveraged by external investments that are realized and/or planned [to be defined more in detail]

title.narrative: Inclusive, climate-resilient landscapes

description.narrative: Outcomes are envisioned to lead to an increased area under improved, climate-resilient sustainable landscape management. This area includes areas of various land use types (e.g. farmland, forests, wetlands) where sustainable management (e.g. local control, certification schemes) or other practices (e.g. protection, restoration, company commitments) have been implemented, increasing the adaptive capacity of ecosystems and the protection of livelihoods against climate change.

title.narrative: # hectares under improved, climate-resilient sustainable landscape management

description.narrative: Area under sustainable landscape governance that has been realized or planned [to be defined more in detail]

title.narrative: Improved, sustainable livelihoods

description.narrative: This impact includes people that benefit from improved access to climate-resilient services, nature-based solutions, adoption of climate-smart practices, protection to climate risks, inclusive business arrangements, inclusive landscape governance initiatives, and the resulting increase in wellbeing and economic prospects.

title.narrative: # people with improved, sustainable livelihoods

description.narrative: [Number] of males [Number] of female [Number] of youth (<30 year) in the landscape with reduced vulnerability to climate hazards, outside the sphere of control [to be defined more in detail]
